error.signature: Error: fatal: could not read Username for 'https://github.com': terminal prompts disabled
error.regex: (?:could not read Username|Authentication failed|fatal: repository.*not found|remote: Repository not found|The requested URL returned error: 403)

verdict.summary: The actions/checkout step fails due to authentication issues when cloning the repository. Common in private repos, cross-repo checkouts, and submodule scenarios.

dead_ends.action: Use git clone with hardcoded credentials in a run step
dead_ends.why_fails: Credentials are exposed in workflow logs and violate security best practices; also breaks when credentials rotate

dead_ends.action: Disable checkout entirely and fetch code manually without proper auth
dead_ends.why_fails: Manual git operations without proper token setup face the same authentication issues

workarounds.action: Use actions/checkout with a PAT or deploy key for private/cross-repo access
workarounds.how: Set 'token: ${{ secrets.PAT_TOKEN }}' in the checkout step for cross-repo access, or configure a deploy key for the specific repository

workarounds.action: Configure persist-credentials and set proper permissions for submodules
workarounds.how: Add 'submodules: recursive' and 'token: ${{ secrets.PAT_TOKEN }}' to the checkout step. Ensure the token has access to all submodule repositories

leads_to.condition: When checkout succeeds but subsequent API calls fail due to token scope limitations

preceded_by.condition: When the PAT secret needed for checkout was not configured

frequently_confused_with.distinction: Checkout failed is about git clone authentication; permission denied is about GitHub API resource access scopes
